title: Palisades football team handles Wilson
text:
Complete Box Score Â» 
Palisades 35, Wilson 7 -- Rapid Recap 
Palisades High School's football team controlled play throughout on Saturday afternoon and went on to post a 35-7 Colonial League victory over Wilson at Smith Field 
Turning point : Senior Austin Krauss ran 17 yards for a touchdown, after a pump fake, to give Palisades a 7-0 lead with 5:36 left in the first quarter. Wilson was unable to manufacture much offense in the first half and the Pirates were in control the rest of the way. 
Top performers : Krauss rushed for 31 yards and two touchdowns and passed 72 yards to Pat Lodwig for another score. Lodwig also rushed for 54 yards and a score, and Matt McGrath added 77 rushing yards and a TD. 
What it means : Palisades wins its third game in four tries to square its record at 3-3. Wilson, which fell to 1-5, was unable to use the momentum gained from last week's 21-20 win at Catasauqua to its advantage. 
Tom Hinkel may be reached at thinkel@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @TomHinkelLV . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook
